# Urban vs Rural Systems
- Why are urban systems considered progressive?
	- Urban systems have basic needs like food, home, shelter so they can consider 'progressive' and liberal ideas. 
	- Maslow's hierarchy of needs states that the idea of individuals' most basic needs need to be met before they become motivated to reach higher level needs.
	- "metamotivation" â†’ and going beyond the scope of basic needs and strive for further development.
	- ![Pasted image 20220712103615.png](data:image/png;base64,)
	- ![Pasted image 20220712103618.png](data:image/png;base64,)
- Components of urban systems
	- Healthcare
	- Education
	- Infrastructure
	- Job diversity
	- Technological advancement
- "How is the land distribution and the places where people like brocrats live affecting urban systems?"
